Feesâ€»: 1.Entrance tickets of YunGang Grottoes is 125RMB, Students can get discount. (Master and PHD donâ€™t work) 2.Entrance tickets of Hanging Temple is 30RMB, getting on the temple is 100RMB, students can get discount. (If it is not open, then we will skip it)

Notes

1.Things to bring: Gateport; Student card or book; cash; Waterproof jacket and trousers; Sturdy shoes, hiking boots if possible; Camera and charger, batteries; Mobile phone, charger; Hayfever medication; Tissues and wipes. 2.Please take your student book for this trip. Master and PHD donâ€™t work. Our leader will trip to get discount entrance tickets for the group

12ï¼š30 åˆ°è¾¾äº‘å†ˆçŸ³çªŸ â‘ æ‹é›†ä½“ç…§ â‘¡å”®ç¥¨å…è´­ä¹°é—¨ç¥¨
äº‘å†ˆçŸ³çªŸä»‹ç»è¯Yungang Grottoes

The Yungang grottoes was built in the Northern Wei dynasty, which was ordered by emperor Wencheng, which has a history of 1,500 years. It was magnificent, and it was almost completed in 30 years.
Yungang grottoes are divided into three parts: east, middle and west.
The shrines in the grottoes are like a hive of honeycomb, and the large, middle and small grottoes are imbedded in the middle of the mountain.
East(1-4): The grottoes here are mostly towers, and large and small towers are arranged in neat rows. So the eastern grottoes are called the tower cave. Cave 1 and Cave 2 have suffered from rigors of time and the weather. Cave 3 is the largest grotto among Yungang caves.
å°å­”å’Œå½©ç»˜ç”±æ¥(holes and coulors)ï¼šIn Qing dynasty, it was popular to draw on Buddhas and made them colorful. In order to prevent the grottoes from weathering, craftsmen drilled holes in the stone statues and inserted wooden rods. Then, the wooden rods were wrapped with ropes to increase the friction of the stone statues and prevent the soil covered by them from falling. Then, the stone statues were covered with clay and painted.
But China suffered after Qing dynasty, and nobody took care of them for long time, and the woods were corroded with clay, so here only thousands of holes left.
Anyway, it seen as a failure repairments. They became bad artworks for it is too artificial and vulgar, you know, there are too much colors. Many artists believe the original works will look more natural and even more solid.

Middle(5-13): Each grotto in the middle is divided into two Chambers/rooms (å®¤). The main Buddha center, the cave wall and the ceiling are full of relief sculpture.
The fifth cave is hereï¼ˆçœ¼ç ï¼‰. The central seated statue of the third Buddha in the grottoes is the largest Buddha statue in the grottoes. And guess why these Buddha have no eyes? (1. Made by special stones which could move and shine in the night 2. After North Wei Dynasty, stolen by nomadic people; in modern history, stolen by people from western countries or sold by businessman). And you will see a ceramic/porcelain eye in nearby museum, which lost in America and return to China 25 years ago.
This is the sixth caveï¼ˆé‡Šè¿¦ç‰Ÿå°¼æ•…äº‹ï¼‰. It is the most representative cave here. There are murals(å£ç”») on every side of the floor, surrounded by statues of Buddha, Bodhisattvas(è©è¨) and flying gods. The wall is carved with the story of Shakyamuni from birth to Buddhahood. You can have a good look at it. Key words: born under a tree; lotus; attract; luxurious; army; decide to leave home and become a monk (â€œå‡ºå®¶â€ç”±æ¥)
The Bodhisattva was engraved in seventh cave. It is lower than other Buddha, just because of the lower statue of a prince in North Wei Dynasty. In the history, he was died in young age and cannot succeed to the throne.
Behind the eighth caveï¼ˆéœ²é½¿ç¬‘è©è¨ & æ¹¿å©†ï¼‰, there is a Bodhisattvas who smile and even show her teeth! ï¼ˆæ¨èï¼šå¤§åŒåä¸¥å¯ºæœ‰è¾½æœçš„éœ²é½¿ç¬‘è©è¨ï¼‰the rare seen Shiva Statue(Shiva is a god of death in Hinduism, another religion, which have similar source with Buddhism) in Yungang with eight arms and four heads and riding on a bull.
Ninth cave and tenth caveï¼ˆä¹å™¨ï¼‰are notable for front pillars and figures bearing musical instruments. Musicians playing instruments also appear in twelfth cave. Tirth cave has the Buddha statue with a giant figurine supporting its right arm.
West: smaller and were built later and cannot compare to their better preserved counterparts.

åä¸¥å¯º Huayan Temple (æ·¡å­£é—¨ç¥¨ 40 å­¦ç”Ÿ 20) åä¸¥å®å¡”&åˆæŒéœ²é½¿ç¬‘è©è¨
Huayan sutra is a famous scriptures in Buddism. Using this name, it was built as a large architectural complex in Liao Dynasty (1038 AD). In the history, it was repaired many times because of destroy by war and fire. Huayan Pagoda was built by wood in Qing dynasty, but also destroyed. Then Datong government decide to rebuilt it ten years ago. Its underground palace is splendid, which has thousands of buddhas made by brass (metal). Whatâ€™s more, there has a Buddhist relics(èˆåˆ©å­, bone ash of famous monks)
That Bodhisattvaâ€™s story is also impressive. A craftsman was busy to build the temple for empire. He missed his daughter, but he couldnâ€™t go back home, so he made it to memorize her smile.

å‡¤å‡°ä¼ è¯´phoenix legendï¼šæ²¡æœ‰è¥¿å…³According to a legend, a warrior with arrowed and breaks phoenixâ€™s right wings. The phoenix was injured, then landed into Datong city. Therefore, Datong is also known as â€œphoenix cityâ€. South pass is like a phoenix head, north pass is like tail, east pass is like the left wing of A phoenix, but there is no west pass (injured and wingless). However, in fact, it was designed for guard and defense.

The Xuankong Temple was built in the late years of the Northern Wei Dynasty (around 471-523 AD), some 1,400 years ago. The existing building is the ruins of the renovations carried out in the Ming and Qing dynasties. The temple is the only existing one featuring the integration Buddhist, Taoist and Confucian cultures. Completely built on the mountain cliff, the wood-structure temple is supported by the beams inserted into the holes in the cliff. (So, in fact, there are without any columns first built, and those long columns are added later. It is not for supporting, but just for reducing your fearâ€¦) The temple is suspended in the air, with precipices on the top and chasms at the bottom. Looked from a far, the temple is like a wonderful sculpture; looked closer, the temple is on the point of flying into the sky. There are over 40 halls in the temple and more than 80 Buddhist sculptures made of bronze, iron, stone and mud. A famous poet Li Bai of the Tang Dynasty wrote â€œå£®è§‚â€ (which means â€˜spectacularâ€) on the cliff wall. And the great traveler Xu Xiake of the Ming Dynasty called the Temple â€œa marvelous wonderâ€ in his travel notes

My dear friends, welcome to CET trip, I am your three-day trip leader, Amanda (Tel. 18230463589). Here as follows are the most important information.

MEETING SCHEDULE: in case of the traffic jam on the way and save our time for enjoying the trip, please arrive at the pickup point on timeï¼š

Meeting time: 04:20am

Meeting time: 04:30am
Meeting point 3: Peking University zhong guan xin yuan

OTHER THINGS: Please check all the notes posted in our WeChat group, make sure you bring all the things needed (especially ID card or passport).

PLUS: If you are vegetarian, please let me know. We will offer you special dishes.
Thanks for your cooperation!

Note: My name is Mia, I amâ€¦â€¦.
I will tell you arrangements in these three days. The first day, we will go to Xilamule grassland. We will ride horse, experience firebrand party and spend a night in Mongolian Yurt. In addition, sunset and sunrise are really amazing in the vast grassland. Next day, Kubuqi Desert is the major destination, there you can ride camel, sand-sliding, cable car etc. We will drive to Hohhot city, and visit a great museum in the last day, and have hot-pot to finish our trip.
Pls prepare the money (600 rmb), you can pay by Wechat or cash. But pls take photos for your cash code if you pay this way.
å¦‚æœä¹˜å®¢é—®why desert: è‡ªç„¶æ¡ä»¶å¹²ç‡¥é™æ°´å°‘ Nature condition, little rain all around year and too dry, less trees è¿‡åº¦æ”¾ç‰§overstock, people breeds too many sheep and cows äººä¸ºç ´å built lots of houses and other buildings and destroy the grassland.
But now our country spare no efforts to plant trees to conserve soil and water and protect the lands. Just like Ali, we can use the Ant Forest feature to collect green energy and plant virtual trees in Kabuki desert. That is really popular in china.

2019å¹´å†…è’™å¤åšç‰©é™¢å¼€è®¾äº†12ä¸ªé™ˆåˆ—å±•è§ˆã€‚å…¶ä¸­é‡ç‚¹è®¾å®šâ€œè¿œå¤ä¸–ç•Œâ€ã€â€œæ–‡æ˜æ›™å…‰â€ã€â€œè¾¹å…³å²æœˆâ€ã€â€œå¤§è¾½å¥‘ä¸¹â€ã€â€œå¤©éª„è’™å¤â€ã€â€œè‰åŸä¸°ç¢‘â€å…­å¤§**é‡ç‚¹**é™ˆåˆ—ï¼Œç€é‡åæ˜ è’™å¤é«˜åŸä»æ··æ²Œåˆå¼€åˆ°è‰åŸæ–‡æ˜èµ·æºã€å‘å±•ã€å‡åçš„å†å²è¿›ç¨‹ã€‚

In 2019, the Inner Mongolia museum opened 12 exhibitions. 6 basic and key exhibitions include T**he Ancient World, Dawn of Civilization, The Your years, The Great Liao of Khitan, The Proud Son of Heaven and Grassland Monument, which reflect the historical process of Mongolian Plateau from chaos to civilization.

å€¼å¾—ä¸€æçš„æ˜¯ï¼Œå†…è’™å¤åšç‰©é™¢ä»¥æ”¶è—å¤ç”Ÿç‰©åŒ–çŸ³ã€å¥‘ä¸¹å†å²æ–‡ç‰©ã€è’™å¤æ—æ–‡ç‰©ä¸ºç‰¹è‰²ã€‚å»ºè®®é‡ç‚¹å‚è§‚è¿œå¤ä¸–ç•Œã€å¤©éª„è’™å¤ã€å¤§è¾½å¥‘ä¸¹ä¸‰ä¸ªç‰¹è‰²å±•å…ï¼ˆçº¦90åˆ†é’Ÿï¼‰ã€‚

In particular, Inner Mongolia Museum has been characterized by the collection of paleontology fossils, Khitan historical relics, and Mongolian cultural relics. Due to the limited time, we are advised to focus on these exhibitions: The Ancient World(F2, No.5), The Proud Son of Heaven (F3, No.3), The Great Liao of Khitan(F4, No.2), while we can also take a quick look for other exhibitions. Following are the guide maps in 2019.

å¹³é¢å¯¼è§ˆå›¾ Guide Maps

ï¼ˆwordå›¾ç‰‡æ‡’å¾—æ’äº†ï¼‰

æç¤ºï¼šåšç‰©é™¢æœ‰å››å±‚ï¼Œç¬¬ä¸€äºŒå±‚ä¸»è¦å±•è§ˆäº†å†…è’™å¤ç›¸å…³çš„åœ°ç†ã€å¤ç”Ÿç‰©ç­‰è‡ªç„¶ç§‘å­¦çŸ¥è¯†ï¼Œè€Œä¸‰å››å±‚ä¸»è¦è®²è¿°å†…è’™å¤é£åœŸäººæƒ…å’Œäººæ–‡å†å²ã€‚

Notes: The museum has four floors. The 1st and 2nd floor mainly display something about natural science in Inner Mongolia, such as geography and pale**o**biology, while the 3rd and 4th floor show local culture and history.

é‡ç‚¹å±•å… Key Exihibitions

1ã€è¿œå¤ä¸–ç•Œ The Acient World

l Overview: This is an exhibition about Inner Mongoliaâ€™s natural fossils and environment in ancient time, which shows the huge change of marvelous ancient ecological environment in Inner Mongolia from three billion to ten thousand years ago, especially Mesozoic and tertiary, quaternary mammals dinosaurs fossil specimens.

Politics: The Khitan people established a great Liao. And had five capital cities to confront the Song. Khitan ruled for Liao Dynasty more than 200 years (907-1125 AD).

Art: These include ceramics, bronze ware, music, dancing and ornamentation (such as Dragon & Phoenix and Mandarin Duck), which shows how they were influenced deeply by the Han Chinese.

Religion: Mostly Shamanism. However, with the expansion of territory, the difficulty of state administration increased, and the emperor advocated the parallel development of Confucianism, Buddhism and other religions. Then, Buddhism flourished, and many Buddhist temples and temples were constructed in the Khitan society, such as the wooden pagoda and Huayan pagoda in Yingxian county, Datong county, Shanxi Province.

(Notes: Just like this model here, there are seven story pagodas in the basement, which we can climb up. In addition, we recommend that you can visit the Datong City in Shanxi, where many buildings witness this history.)

Disappear: 200 years later, the Liao official corruption and the decline of national strength, the collapse of the great Liao by the Jin dynasty, the Khitan people everywhere disappeared. Unit 1 ç†”é“å‡ºå±± æ°‘æ—åˆå…´ The Emergence of the Mongols

The Mongolian nationality originates from Silik river. The Mongolian people live on the grassland and make a living from animal husbandry. Living a nomadic life, although this way of living has been weakened in modern society, it is still regarded as a symbol of the Mongolian people.

è’™å¤æ—å§‹æºäºå¤ä»£æœ›å»ºæ²³ï¼ˆä»Šé¢å°”å¤çº³æ²³ï¼‰ä¸œå²¸ä¸€å¸¦ã€‚è’™å¤æ—äººæ°‘ä¸–å±…è‰åŸï¼Œä»¥ç•œç‰§ä¸ºç”Ÿè®¡ã€‚è¿‡ç€â€œé€æ°´è‰è€Œå±…â€çš„æ¸¸ç‰§ç”Ÿæ´»ï¼Œå°½ç®¡è¿™ç§ç”Ÿå­˜æ–¹å¼åœ¨ç°ä»£ç¤¾ä¼šè¢«å¼±åŒ–ï¼Œä½†ä»ç„¶è¢«è§†ä½œè’™å¤æ—çš„æ ‡å¿—ã€‚

Unit 2 é€é¹¿ç¾¤é›„ æ±—å›½å´›èµ· Rise of The Great Mongol Nation

Tiemuzhen began to unify the Mongolian plateau in the middle of the 12th century. At the beginning of the 13th century, he united the Mongol tribes and gradually formed a new national community. And he also owed the name Genghis Khan. He created the writing system, the army, the officers and so on, which lead to a country system. He constantly launched aggressive wars to expand his territory, and the invasion looms even over eastern Europe, which made the Mongols became famous and went to the world.

é“æœ¨çœŸä»12ä¸–çºªä¸­å¶å¼€å§‹ç»Ÿä¸€è’™å¤é«˜åŸçš„äº‹ä¸šã€‚13ä¸–çºªåˆï¼Œä»¥ä»–ä¸ºé¦–çš„è’™å¤éƒ¨ç»Ÿä¸€äº†è’™å¤åœ°åŒºè¯¸éƒ¨ï¼Œé€æ¸å½¢æˆäº†ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„æ°‘æ—å…±åŒä½“ï¼Œä»–ä¹Ÿè¢«å°Šç§°ä¸ºæˆå‰æ€æ±—ã€‚ä»–åˆ›å»ºæ–‡å­—ã€ç»„å»ºå†›é˜Ÿã€è®¾ç½®å®˜å‘˜ç­‰æªæ–½åˆ›å»ºäº†å®Œæ•´çš„å›½å®¶åˆ¶åº¦ã€‚ä»–å—å¾åŒ—æˆ˜å¼€é˜”ç–†åœŸï¼Œç”šè‡³ä¾µç•¥é€¼è¿‘ä¸œæ¬§ï¼Œè¿™äº›è®©è’™å¤æ°‘æ—æˆåå¹¶èµ°å‘äº†ä¸–ç•Œã€‚

Unit 3 å¤§å…ƒç››ä¸– å¤šå…ƒå…±è Glory of The Yuan Dinasty

The yuan dynasty, founded by the Mongol nationality, was the first unified dynasty established by the ethnic minorities in Chinese history. The capital of Dadu (now Beijing), handed down to the fifth and eleventh emperors, lasted 98 years.

å…ƒæœç”±è’™å¤æ—å»ºç«‹ï¼Œæ˜¯ä¸­å›½å†å²ä¸Šé¦–æ¬¡ç”±å°‘æ•°æ°‘æ—å»ºç«‹çš„å¤§ä¸€ç»Ÿç‹æœã€‚å®šéƒ½å¤§éƒ½ï¼ˆä»ŠåŒ—äº¬ï¼‰ï¼Œä¼ äº”ä¸–åä¸€å¸ï¼Œå†æ—¶ä¹åå…«å¹´ã€‚

Unit 4 æ˜æ¸…è’™å¤ ç»µç»­ç¹è¡ Mongols in The Ming and Qing Dynasty

After the collapse of the yuan dynasty, the remaining forces retreated to the Mongolian grasslands. The Ming emperor set up more than 20 Mongol Wei Suo (leader in areas), each chief is held by the feudal Lord of Mongolia. At the beginning of the 15th century, the Mongolians had to pay tribute to the Ming dynasty, and established a relationship of subordination.

Unit 5 æ¸¸ç‰§é£éŸµ å¤©äººåˆä¸€ Nomadic Life and Religious Beliefs

The Mongolians in the Qing dynasty still kept livestock such as horses and sheep as their main business. The nomadic Mongolians are more characteristic of grassland in terms of clothing, food, shelter and transportation. They have many pioneering creations, such as the Mongolian womenâ€™s clothing. The Qing dynasty introduced Tibetan Buddhism to Mongolia.

The exhibition will lead the audience into the unique natural ecological world in Inner Mongolia.

åœ¨æœ¬å­¦æœŸã€Šç»„ç»‡ä¸ç®¡ç†ç ”ç©¶ã€‹è¯¾ç¨‹å­¦ä¹ è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘å—ç›Šè‰¯å¤šã€‚æˆ‘çš„æ”¶è·ä¸»è¦æ¥è‡ªä»¥ä¸‹å››ä¸ªéƒ¨åˆ†ã€‚

1 The Course: The Big Picture

å®è§‚è€Œè¨€ï¼Œåœ¨è¿™é—¨è¯¾ç¨‹ä¸­æˆ‘é¢†æ‚Ÿåˆ°çš„å…³äºæ€ç»´è®¤çŸ¥çš„éƒ¨åˆ†ä¸»è¦åœ¨äºå¯¹æŠ½è±¡çŸ¥è¯†çš„ç†è§£å’Œä¸€äº›æ€è€ƒï¼Œå¦å¤–å­¦ä¹ åˆ°çš„å…³äºç ”ç©¶æ–¹æ³•çš„éƒ¨åˆ†ä¹Ÿé¢‡å…·ä»·å€¼ã€‚

1.1 Abstract Knowledge and Perspectives

Conceptsâ€™ Distinction & Connection

åœ¨æœ¬ç§‘é˜¶æ®µç®¡ç†å­¦çš„å­¦ä¹ è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘å‘ç°è‡ªå·±å¯¹â€œç»„ç»‡â€â€œç®¡ç†â€â€œå…¬å¸â€ç­‰é‡è¦æ¦‚å¿µæœ¬èº«çš„ç†è§£æ¯”è¾ƒè‚¤æµ…ã€‚è€Œè¯¥è¯¾ç¨‹å¸®åŠ©æˆ‘å¯¹ä¸€äº›å…³é”®æ¦‚å¿µè¿›è¡ŒåŒºåˆ†ï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯å¯¹æ›¾ç»å­¦çš„ç®¡ç†ç§‘å­¦ä¸å·¥ç¨‹å’Œç›®å‰ç ”ç©¶çš„å·¥å•†ç®¡ç†é¢†åŸŸçš„ç ”ç©¶å¯¹è±¡æœ‰äº†æ›´ä¸ºæ¸…æ™°çš„è®¤è¯†ã€‚

æ¯”å¦‚ï¼ŒAdministrationå’ŒManagementç¿»è¯‘ä¸ºä¸­æ–‡éƒ½æ˜¯ç®¡ç†çš„æ„æ€ã€‚ä½†ç©¶å…¶è¯æºå¯ä»¥å‘ç°ï¼Œå‰è€…çš„å®šä¹‰æ›´ä¸ºç‹­éš˜ï¼Œå…³æ³¨ç®¡ç†è¿‡ç¨‹å’Œç¨‹åºè§„èŒƒï¼Œè€Œåè€…çš„æ¶µç›–é¢åˆ™æ›´ä¸ºå®½æ³›ï¼Œæ›´å¤šç ”ç©¶å…³äºç»“æœçš„å®ç°å’Œç»„ç»‡ä¸­çš„ä¸ªä½“æ‰€æ‰¿æ‹…çš„è´£ä»»å’Œé¢ä¸´çš„ç¤¾ä¼šç¯å¢ƒç­‰æ›´ä¸ºå®è§‚çš„å› ç´ ã€‚å†å¦‚organizationå’Œfirmï¼Œå†åŠ ä¸Šæˆ‘ç‹¬è‡ªæ€è€ƒçš„institution/instituteï¼Œè¿™å››è€…è™½ç„¶éƒ½æ˜¯ç»„ç»‡æˆ–ç»„ç»‡çš„è¡¨ç°å½¢å¼ï¼Œä½†å´æœ‰ç€ä¸åŒçš„å†…æ¶µã€‚æˆ‘è®¤ä¸ºï¼Œå¯¹è¿™äº›æ¦‚å¿µçš„å˜æ¸…å°†å¯¹ç°é˜¶æ®µçš„ç ”ç©¶å®šä½å’Œæœªæ¥çš„ç§‘ç ”ç”Ÿæ¶¯å¤§æœ‰è£¨ç›Šã€‚

Research Perspectives

å¦‚æœç§‘å­¦çš„ç›®æ ‡æ˜¯ä»ç°å®é‡Œæ¢ç´¢çœŸç†ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆæˆ‘ä»¬é¦–å…ˆè¦è€ƒè™‘ä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯ç°å®ä¸–ç•Œã€‚åœ¨è¯¾ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å­¦ä¹ äº†å››ç§æ€»è§‚ç‚¹ï¼Œç”¨ä»¥è§‚å¯Ÿã€ç†è§£å’Œè§£é‡Šæˆ‘ä»¬ç”Ÿæ´»ä¸­çš„ç»„ç»‡ä¸ç®¡ç†ç°å®ã€‚

ç¬¬ä¸€ï¼Œå¤å…¸å­¦æ´¾è§‚ç‚¹ï¼ˆä¹Ÿè¢«ç§°ä¸ºå‰ç°ä»£è§‚ç‚¹ï¼‰ï¼Œå³ç›¸ä¿¡åªæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªç°å®ï¼Œä¸”ç°å®ç‹¬ç«‹äºä¸»è§‚çš„ç»éªŒæˆ–é˜é‡Šã€‚åœ¨ç»„ç»‡ç ”ç©¶ä¸­ï¼Œåˆåˆ†ä¸ºç¤¾ä¼šå­¦å’Œç®¡ç†å­¦ä¸¤ç§å­¦æœ¯æµæ´¾ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚éŸ¦ä¼¯çš„ç§‘å±‚åˆ¶å’Œæ³°å‹’çš„ç§‘å­¦ç®¡ç†ã€‚ç¬¬äºŒï¼Œç°ä»£è§‚ç‚¹ï¼Œèµ·æºäºç³»ç»Ÿè®ºå’Œç”Ÿç†å­¦ï¼Œè®¤ä¸ºæ—¢å­˜åœ¨å®¢è§‚ç°å®ï¼Œä¹Ÿå­˜åœ¨å¯¹æ­¤çš„ä¸»è§‚ç»éªŒçš„å¤šæ ·æ€§ã€‚ç°ä»£è§‚ç‚¹å­¦è€…å°†è§†ä¸ºç»„ç»‡å¼€æ”¾çš„ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œè€Œè¿™åœ¨æƒå˜ç†è®ºã€ç»„ç»‡ç”Ÿæ€ç†è®ºã€åˆ¶åº¦ç†è®ºç­‰ç†è®ºä½“ç³»ä¸­å¾—åˆ°äº†å¹¿æ³›çš„åº”ç”¨ã€‚ç¬¬ä¸‰ï¼Œè±¡å¾-è§£é‡Šè§‚ç‚¹ï¼Œè®¤ä¸ºå¯¹ç°å®æ¥æºäºç»éªŒå’Œä½“éªŒï¼Œèµ·æºäºåˆ¶å®šç†è®ºï¼Œå…³æ³¨ç»„ç»‡çš„ä¸»è§‚æ„è¯†çš„èµ·æºï¼Œä¾§é‡äºç¤¾ä¼šå¿ƒç†çš„ç ”ç©¶ï¼Œè€Œè¯¾ç¨‹æœ€åçš„æ„ä¹‰å»ºæ„ç†è®ºå°±æ˜¯å…¸å‹çš„è±¡å¾-è§£é‡Šç ”ç©¶è§†è§’ã€‚ç¬¬å››ï¼Œåç°ä»£è§‚ç‚¹ï¼Œè®¤ä¸ºç°å®æ˜¯å®Œå…¨ä¸ç»éªŒæœ‰å…³çš„ï¼Œå…³æ³¨å¤šæ ·æ€§å’Œè§£æ„ç­‰ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ç»„ç»‡æ–‡åŒ–çš„ç°è±¡å­¦ç ”ç©¶è§†è§’ï¼Œä½†ç›®å‰å°šæœªå‡ºç°æ ¸å¿ƒçš„ç†è®ºæˆ–ä»£è¡¨çš„æ€æƒ³å®¶ã€‚

åœ¨ç ”ç©¶é˜…è¯»è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘é€æ¸ç†è§£äº†ç¤¾ä¼šç§‘å­¦é¢ä¸´ç€ä¸è‡ªç„¶ç§‘å­¦è¿¥å¼‚çš„ç ”ç©¶å¯¹è±¡ç‰¹æ€§ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶åˆå­˜åœ¨ç€æ»¡è¶³ç§‘å­¦å®¢è§‚æ€§è¦æ±‚çš„å¯èƒ½ã€‚å› æ­¤ç¤¾ä¼šç°è±¡å¯ä»¥æ—¢æ˜¯çœŸå®çš„ï¼Œåˆæ˜¯å†å²å¶ç„¶å¼çš„äººç±»åˆ›é€ [1]ã€‚ç»§è€Œï¼Œæˆ‘ä¸ªäººæ¯”è¾ƒå€¾å‘äºç°ä»£è§‚ç‚¹å’Œè±¡å¾-è§£é‡Šè§‚ç‚¹è¿™ä¸¤ç§è§‚ç‚¹çœ‹å¾…ç°å®ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶ï¼ŒåˆåŠªåŠ›ä»¥å¼€æ”¾çš„çœ¼å…‰å»ç†è§£å…¶ä»–è§†è§’ä¸‹çš„ç ”ç©¶ï¼Œè®¤è¯†ä¸åŒå­¦æ´¾çš„æ€æƒ³ï¼Œç«™åœ¨ä»–ä»¬çš„è§’åº¦è§‚å¯Ÿç†è§£ç°å®ã€‚

The Understanding of Disciplines

æˆ‘ä»¥ä¸ºç®¡ç†å­¦æœ€ä»¤äººæƒŠå¥‡å’Œèµå¹ä¹‹å¤„ï¼Œå°±åœ¨äºå…¶è§¦åŠé¢†åŸŸçš„å¤šå…ƒå’Œå®½æ³›ï¼Œåœ¨äºå…¶ä¸åŸºç¡€å­¦ç§‘çš„äº¤å‰å’Œå·§å¦™èåˆï¼Œåœ¨äºå¥¹è¿‘ä¹æ— è¾¹ç•Œçš„å¼€æ”¾çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œä»¥åŠä¸€ç§ç±»ä¼¼ã€Šé“å¾·ç»ã€‹ä¸­â€œä¸‡äº‹ä¸‡ç‰©çš†ä¸ºæˆ‘æ‰€ç”¨â€çš„åŒ…å®¹ç†å¿µã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬ä¸éš¾å‘ç°ï¼Œå¤§å¤šç®¡ç†ç†è®ºå­¦å®¶æ€»æ˜¯å·§å¦™åœ°èåˆå…¶ä»–å­¦ç§‘çš„ç²¾åä¹‹å¤„ï¼Œå¯¹ä¸åŒç†è®ºçš„è¦ç´ è¿›è¡Œåˆç†ç»„åˆä¸åŠ å·¥ï¼Œä»è€Œå®ç°ç®¡ç†ç†è®ºåˆ›æ–°ã€‚æˆ‘æƒ³ï¼Œæ‰€è°“â€œåˆ›é€ æºäºè”ç³»ï¼Œè·¨ç•Œäº§ç”Ÿåˆ›æ–°â€å°±æ˜¯è¿™ä¸ªé“ç†ã€‚
